text: We declare evidence of an outbreak signature ( test positive ) , at time t if the observed detection value D k , t is larger than a given threshold . For a fixed value of α , let 1 - α denote the specificity ( the probability of a true - negative ) . Similarly , the sensitivity is defined to be the probability of true positive . The threshold , τ k , α , is chosen by solving P ( D k , t > τ k , α ) = α for τ k , α . Either we can estimate this value from the data using the 1 - α quantile of the { D k , t } process of non - outbreak - based training data , or if { X k , t } is Gaussian then for large m ,
